A reporting form based on data source
To represent the data of the generated
source
visually, you need to configure a user reporting form
. The configured report form allows you to specify data groupings and set formatting for data text and Excel table headers (if you download the report).
To set up a reporting form based on data source, you need to:
1. Create a reporting form based on the data source from the corresponding registry. For more information, refer to
Working with the object registry
.
2. Specify parameters for the report form:
Name
Entering the report name. This name will be displayed to the end user.
Data source
Choosing the data source formed earlier, on the basis of which you want to create a report.
Report header grouping
Defining the report header grouping. This option is available after saving the reporting form profile. To group or ungroup data, you need to select the required columns (like you do it with the grouping of columns in MS Excel documents). As a result, the corresponding buttons will appear:
,
, which will be available to the user when viewing the report data.
Object parameters
Specifying the reporting form parameters. It displays and assigns
selected data source parameters
. Parameters can be adjusted if necessary. New parameters of the reporting form can be added.
Header formatting style
Defining the header formatting style (selecting/creating an algorithm).
Report title style
Defining the report title formatting style (selecting/creating an algorithm).
Report title algorithm
Defining the report title (a dynamic text generated by the algorithm).
Managing the order in which data is presented in an exported MS Excel report
Fixed columns number
Specifying the required number of columns to display (integer value).
Fixed rows number
Specifying the required number of rows to display (integer value).
Output parameters when exporting
A boolean attribute that defines how parameters are displayed in Excel table.
Enable autofilters when exporting
A boolean attribute that specifies the availability of the AutoFilter of data in Excel table.
Excel sheet orientation
Defining the orientation of the Excel sheet. Possible values:
Landscape
Portrait
Use the print area by default
A boolean attribute that defines the use of the Excel worksheet print area by default.
Page layout – the width (of pages)
The number of pages of an Excel document counted per sheet (how wide) when printing.
Page layout – the height (of pages)
The number of pages of an Excel document counted per sheet (how high) when printing.
Page layout – scale (%)
Defining the scale of the data representation when printing a document as a percentage of the actual value.
The established order of data representation in the exported report is automatically recorded in the MS Excel document.
3. To save the reporting form generated, click
. In this case, the System will display the generated columns of the report table and the parameters of the objects of the data source used (if any). If necessary, you can return to editing the reporting form (for more information, refer to
Working with the object registry
).
4. To close the profile "Reporting form based on data source" (presented in the modal window), click
.
This will generate a user reporting form.
Working with a reporting form (including viewing a report) is similar to interacting with a data source, for more information, refer to
Working with data sources
.
